Who is Hardjedef and what is his significance in ancient Egyptian literature?
answers: Hardjedef was an ancient Egyptian sage whose Instruction, the Teaching of Hordedef and Teaching of Djedefhor, is possibly the oldest of all known Instructions, composed during the 5th Dynasty. He enjoyed a reputation for wisdom in ancient times and his name appears in the Westcar Papyrus and the Harper's lay from the tomb of King Intef. His maxims have survived while his tomb has been lost, making him especially famous during periods of classicistic revival when he and other Old Kingdom sages became role models for aspiring scribes.
